Uses of Package
model

Packages that use model
Package
Description
controller
 
model
 
view
 
  • Classes in model used by controller
    Class
    Description
    Dir
    Pre-established set of directions that give dimensionality to the entities that live in this application.
    GameCharacter
    A Game Character is an entity that lives and moves in the game panel but in doing so interacts with the grid.
    GameState
    Class for State Design Pattern
    Heroes
    Set of predefined heroes playable in this video game
    LevelAbstract
    Abstract class used to manage every level subtype.
    MyGridFormat
    Interface with public static field of this videogame parameters grid
    NonPlayableCharacter
    This class models non-player characters.
    NpcMediator
    Mediator that encapsulates dependencies of NPC in every game level.
    PowerUp.Power
    Types of powerup implemented
    Powerupper
    Interface implemented by concrete powerup
    StateLabel
    Labels for the states of Game.
    Theater
    Unequivocal label of a specific level inserted into a determined stage.
    Theater.Scene
    Scene indicates a specific level.
    Theater.Stage
    Stages are level sequences which are characterized by the very same play contexts.
  • Classes in model used by model
    Class
    Description
    Account
    This class contains all the information related to an account created by the user.
    AccountFilter.Filters
    Types of filters
    Bomb
    Class of objects thought to be the bombs of the game.
    Bomb.Type
    Type of implemented bombs
    Boss
    This interface is a label that is implemented by entities that are considered end-of-stage bosses.
    CartesianCoordinate
    This class models a Cartesian point
    Dir
    Pre-established set of directions that give dimensionality to the entities that live in this application.
    Enemy
    An NPC with hostility true against the player character.
    EnemyBoss
    A special enemy whose defeat allows you to complete the stage
    EnemyUnstoppable
    An unstoppable enemy doesn't use visitor mover for moving so it isn't affect by solidity collisions
    Entity
    Class that establishes the basis of any object that directly or indirectly determines the fate of a game scene.
    Figure
    Figure is an entity that exists within the game grid, it occupies a specific space entirely and does not move.
    Fire
    The only Prop that have lethality true.
    Fire.FlameSpread
    Types of fires: they can be the tip of an explosion or inside an arm
    GameCharacter
    A Game Character is an entity that lives and moves in the game panel but in doing so interacts with the grid.
    GameCharacter.Degree
    The degrees represent the pairs of directions that identify the derived and plausible diagonal directions.
    GameModel
    Game Model is the main actor of the application.
    GameState
    Class for State Design Pattern
    Gravedigger
    Class that carries information from a newly destroyed non-player character or collected power Up to notify the Game Model of the score to be added to the current score value.
    Heroes
    Set of predefined heroes playable in this video game
    Hound
    Interface implemented by the entities chasing the main character
    InconsistenArrayException
    Home-made exception for manage array desiderable length
    InconsistentCoordinateException
    Home-made exception to manage insertion of inconsistent grid coordinates
    Lethal
    Interface implemented by Figure that can have lethality true
    LevelAbstract
    Abstract class used to manage every level subtype.
    LevelConcrete
    Class that define what is a level in this game
    LevelConcrete.LevelBuilder
    Builder Pattern to help level construction
    ModelPointer
    Class models a pointer, as a cursor pointer
    ModelTimer
    Class models a Timer counter
    MyGridFormat
    Interface with public static field of this videogame parameters grid
    NonPlayableCharacter
    This class models non-player characters.
    NonPlayableCharacter.Behavior
    Possible behavioral states of the character
    NpcMediator
    Mediator that encapsulates dependencies of NPC in every game level.
    NpcType
    Types of npcs implemented in this version
    Order.Label
    Possible labels to choose
    PlayerCharacter
    Class models an instance of Player Character
    PlayerCharacterConcrete
    Instance of a concrete player character
    PlayerCharacterConcrete.PlayerCharacterBuilder
    Builder Design Pattern for PlayerCharacterConcrete
    PowerUp
    Power Up class.
    PowerUp.Power
    Types of powerup implemented
    PowerUpMediator
    PowerUp are regulated by their mediator.
    PowerUpMediator.Message
    Messages can be send to the mediator
    Powerupper
    Interface implemented by concrete powerup
    Prop
    They are the objects use to be bundle to Tesserae.
    PropWrapper
    This interface permits to locate Prop referral to the implementation
    ReleaseBehavior
    Interface for the Strategy Pattern that defines the bomb release behaviors of the player characters
    Runner
    This interface is recognized by the visitor as a polymorphism of his visit method.
    StateLabel
    Labels for the states of Game.
    TesseraAbstract
    TesseraAbstract is the super type of each concrete Tessera.
    Theater
    Unequivocal label of a specific level inserted into a determined stage.
    Theater.Scene
    Scene indicates a specific level.
    Theater.Stage
    Stages are level sequences which are characterized by the very same play contexts.
    TimerExplosion
    Interface implemented by remote bombs that defines their particular methods
    Visitor
    Interface of a Visitor Design Pattern
    VisitorAcceptor
    Interface implemented by Visitor Acceptors to accept Visitor's visit.
    VisitorCharactersMover
    This Visitor encapsulates all the methods that determine Game Character movement.
